7 Best Value Pellet Smoker Grills For The Money In 2018

November 21, 2018May 6, 2018 by Jack Thompson
52shares
  • Facebook2
  • Pinterest50
  • Twitter
  • Google+

Pellet smokers are not only incredibly easy to use but also incredibly powerful. Some say that a pellet smoker is better than any other type of smoker out there.

The type of fuel used in these smokers are a specific type of wood pellets. You may be wanting to use other types of wood, but we suggest you stick to using only the pellets sold in stores.

In this article, we review the best pellet smokers/grills to help you find yourself a top rated pellet grill. You will not be disappointed by the amazing results of these fabulous machines.

Reviews of the best pellet smokers/grills

1. Green Mountain Davy Crockett Pellet Grill – WIFI enabled

This excellent pellet smoker under $500 with a unique design has found its way into our list and we love it!

Starting with its warranty, we think this is a great offer from the manufacturers for the cost and size of this smoker.

It comes with a thermal sensor which constantly monitors the temperature of the grill while cooking. This makes it a good choice to consider when managing temperatures lowering stress while maintaining the right temperatures.

Consider this machine as an ultimate choice for a tailgating party because of its lightweight and its easily movable features. It has two foldable legs that allow you to stand it on any flat surface. You can also fold the handles as well.

However, you may need to deal with a lot of bending downs as the legs of this machine may be too short for a standard one.

This high-end pellet smoker is WIFI enabled which allows you to control temperatures easily while away from the smoker. This is one of the only smokers on the market to offer this option.

It also comes with a meat probe connected to the temperature controller that allows you to check on the doneness of the food just by fixing the probe through an access hole to the meat.

This is a really cool recommendation for a group of 4 to 6 people and very cost effective on fuel because of the type of pellet it uses. If you are into solar power, this smoker has a 12 Volt jumper cable on a 110 Volt converter. Starting up your device is made easier with this option.
With its versatility, you can grill a pork shoulder, bake a pie, BBQ a chicken, and sear whatever meat you like.

Pros

  • Very portable
  • Versatile cooking abilities
  • Good quality build

Cons

  • Legs may be too short
  • It is heavy for its small size
Check Price on Amazon

2. Camp Chef Woodwind Pellet Grill with Sear Box

If you don’t have the time to be babysitting a smoker, this type is the kind to go for. It is designed with smart smoke technology which feeds the firebox pellets necessary for the right temperature. Food is managed by a digital temperature control and automatic auger.

For a smoker under $1000, its offerings are worth the purchase. It offers a wide cooking surface area which will serve over 12 people at ease.

In addition to its great grill, it comes with a 900 oF side sear box making it the best pellet grill for searing on this list. This provides you with an extra option to sear your food or gives you more space to cook if you need to transfer some food from the main grilling area.

It is easily lighted with an added 16,000 BTU stainless steel burner for easy ignition with a temperature range of 160 oF to 500 oF for good control of heat while cooking and an added meat probe to help you check the food’s doneness.

Its durable grill grates are enamel coated and made with cast iron adding a pretty finish on food. It comes with an ash cleanout system that simplifies the cleaning process during and after cooking. Just pull out the cleaning lever and you are good to go.

Pros

  • Even and perfect cook
  • Simple and convenient cooking
  • Smokes out amazing flavors

Cons

  • Noisy when cooking
  • Material build could be improved
Check Price on Amazon

3. Traeger TFB65LZBC Texas Elite 34 Wood Pellet Grill and Smoker

Priced as an under $1000 smoker, let’s see what this beauty has to offer.

It is one of the most quality builds on the market made of stainless steel and then coated with a durable powder coat finish. This baby will last you for numerous days. Although, you may need to purchase some extra screws to ensure that your smoker is well assembled together.

This great build extends itself to its porcelain coated grates allowing it to be used for years with no signs of rust and also allows for an easy clean by the user. You can expect to have excellent results on your food with beautiful grill marks. Temperature control is made easy with its digital elite controller which makes you able to manage temperatures with ease. Its ignition is quick to start meaning there is no stress to be felt when lighting up your device.

Also, the pellet type for this smoker is just right to ensure that you are not burning out too much fuel just to cook a good meal. This also makes it the best Traeger pellet smoker available.

This smoker has one of the largest cooking surface areas on our list and is highly recommended for a group of 10 to 14 people. You can smoke, grill, bake, roast, braise and BBQ all that you like.

If you are thinking of moving the smoker around, you need not worry as it comes with wheels to fulfill this purpose as well as 2 caster lockers to keep it secured to the ground when ready to cook.

Pros

  • 6 in 1 versatility
  • Huge capacity hopper
  • Large cooking size
  • Easy grease managing system

Cons

  • Provides up to 450 oF only
  • No screws provided for mounting
Check Price on Amazon

4. Camp Chef PG24DLX Deluxe Pellet Grill and Smoker

This barrel-shaped device is a portable pellet grill and averagely priced for a mid-level earner.
With a good stainless steel build, this is one smoker that you should consider. It’s easy to assemble and easy to use making a qualifier for our list.

It is an electrical pellet smoker which allows you to light up your pellets with an electronic auto start ignition. This feature of a smoker is definitely one to be excited about as you no longer will need to have special skills to make your fire.

The smoker is built with an excellent stainless steel probe which aids in measuring internal temperatures. It also includes a dual LED temperature display for easy checks of temperatures.

Clean up is amazing with its exclusive ash cleanout system making it the highest ranked system on the market currently. This allows you to pull out a lever and your ash will find its way out.
The temperature range is between 160oF to 500oF which is more than enough range for the variety of items you will be preparing.

Pros

  • Amazing cleaning system
  • Good cooking area
  • Good durability
  • Easy light up

Cons

  • Short warranty period
  • Needs electricity to start up
Check Price on Amazon

5. Pit Boss 71700FB Pellet Grill with Flame Broiler

The first great thing about this grill is its use of 100% natural wood pellets. You will not have to worry whether the pellets were treated with incorrect chemicals. Your health concerns can be at rest with this unique feature.

Its grill grates are well built to give you long-lasting usage and beautiful results on your food. They are porcelain coated, cast iron made which is one of the best options to have on the market currently.

For a smoker under $500, this baby comes with an innovative flame broiler giving you an added option to broil your food. The burning system is digitally controlled so managing temperatures is made easy.

It has one of the largest cooking surface areas there is to find offering an additional cooking rack for when you need extra room to contain your food. It has an electric ignition for quick light up, two durable wheels for easy mobility and a hopper clean out drawer.

Pros

  • Very spacious cooking area
  • Good in size
  • Affordable
  • Easy to clean

Cons

  • Ordinary smoke flavors
Check Price on Amazon

6. Camp Chef Smokepro STX Pellet Grill

This is a decent and cheap smoker with good features. Starting off with its stainless steel build is finished with the silver vein. No further details said that this device will stand against rust over a long period of time.

It comes with a digital temperature control, an adjustable chimney top to control the smoke flavors, and a stainless steel meat probe to help check for food’s doneness with ease.

Clean out is made easy with its ash cleanout system. You can tuck your brush and dustpan in the shelves, they will not be needed. It also has a grease management system to control the level of grease produced per cook.

It has a decent cooking surface area to make food for 8 to 10 people in one round. It also has a utility rack to keep your utensils and tools while cooking and an additional warming rack with a front shelf.

This is one of the best smokers under $500 that offers many different types of spaces for usage all in one grill.

Pros

  • Large hopper capacity
  • Even heat and smoke distribution
  • Easy to assemble

Cons

  • Pellets are more expensive
Check Price on Amazon

7. Traeger TFB42LZBC Lil Tex Elite 22 Wood Pellet Grill and Smoker

This pellet smoker does not come cheap, but it has some goodies that are worth the add.
It has an electronic auto-start ignition is a really nice feature to have on a smoker so you are not stressing over firing up your pellets.

The pellets used for this machine are made of 100% pure hardwood giving you a long lasting burn on your pellets. In the long run, this will be cost-effective to the user.

The grill grates are made of porcelain which as we said earlier is one of the best materials to have in the construction of your smoker. It does not wear and tear easily with its stainless steel build and powder coated finishing.

The temperature controls are also digital versus manual making this easy to set the exact temperatures desired. Finally, move your smoker around as much as you want and have the ability to stabilize it wherever thanks to the locking casters attached to the wheel.

Pros

  • 6 in 1 versatile cooking
  • Easy temperature setting
  • Easy to clean
  • Easy to use

Cons

  • Needs electrical powering up

What is the best pellet smoker/ grill for us?

On this round of smokers, we are drawn towards technology being one of the things to have on a pellet smoker. The question is, what is the best pellet smoker?

Our best choice will be the Green Mountain Davy Crockett Pellet Grill.

It has the most amazing features on this list and is easily affordable. Its wifi temperature control enablement! Who doesn’t need this in a world that is so tech driven? You literally do not have to pamper your smoker to work, just leave it and control it from wherever with its app.

It is also portable which means a student could have this in his apartment and make food for his friends. Its weight may be relative but we think it is still fine to move around without killing yourself. It is great for everyone!

Features to look out for when purchasing the best pellet smoker/grill

They are heavily flavor driven

Pellet smokers are a unique type of smoker which generates quality smoky flavors rather than the acrid smoke produced from smoking or grilling on straight fire.
This is why you should purchase the best value smoker to highlight the flavors of your food.

Easy and convenient use

Pellet smokers are known not only for their versatility but also for their quick and easy to use instructions.

They are easy to assemble, easy to light up, easy to control temperature with and easy to clean. You will realize that soon enough, grilling at home will be a lovely tradition that the whole family will love to partake in because of the simplicity of its use.

Go for good pricing

You don’t have to break the bank when purchasing one of these high-end smokers.
There are plenty of options on the market that offer you the best value for your budget. Taking your needs into consideration, you will be able to cross check from the list below and make a great purchase for the money.

For what it is worth, please take the time to do the research when looking for the best wood pellet smoker. Don’t let time get the best of you and rush you into making a silly decision.

Great quality build is the best

The best material to look for would be stainless steel and porcelain coats. They are very long lasting materials and have the ability to withstand the test of time and rust from weather changes.

You should also consider other features that come with the smoker. Ensure that it’s fire pit, grates, vents and flame deflector drip pan are built with stainless steel. These features tend to do most of the heavy duty stuff, so you want to ensure that they will last for a lifetime.

Consider food output

When looking for a high-end pellet smoker, consider how much food you will be preparing regularly. If you are just planning to cook for you and your family then you may not need a large pellet smoker. A small or portable pellet grill will suffice your needs.

If you plan on cooking for large amounts of people or hosting large events and parties then you may want to consider buying a larger unit. There are several on the market available to you so make sure and know what your serving size needs will be.

Take note of temperature control

Always look out for a pellet smoker that has a temperature algorithm that is able to hold a constant temperature despite the condition of the weather at hand.

Most pellet grills are designed with antiquated timing sequences to stabilize the cooking temperature within the smoker. No need to worry with controlling temperatures using the dampers or vents as this is already almost sorted.

Minimise the burning of fuel

First of all, burning fuel is not a very eco-friendly practice, so let’s try to avoid this as much as possible. Thanks to the less-fuel-burn technology equipped with pellet smokers, you will not need to use nearly as much fuel as you would think.

With that being said, purchase a pellet grill that will be very fuel efficient when cooking.

You can save that extra money on some more burgers!

The hopper size is key

Look for a sizeable hopper when making a purchase. This advice will come in handy especially for when you have to cook overnight.

It is specifically designed to hold as much heat as possible within the smoker to prevent the use of extra fuel, and constant checks of temperature. This automatically yields good results and is what everybody wants. Gauge for a size of about 40 pounds to keep you in a good target zone.

Check for warranty

Make sure to always check to make sure the warranty will either outweigh the price or the decision you are making. Make sure to research this and make sure that the unit you purchase comes with a great warranty.

It does not make sense to buy a product without a warranty.  And if a pellet smoker is not what you’re looking for, you might want to read this article to know about other types smokers to use.
